headline.main: MORAL LAW HELD KEY TO DURABLE PEACE; Speakers at Catholic Session Put It Above Sovereignty

lead_paragraph: To insure a durable peace after the war the nations of the world must establish the unassailability of the moral law, even above the rights of national sovereignty, speakers declared yesterday at an an-day regional meeting of the Catholic Association for International Peace, held at the De Porres Interracial Center, 20 Vesey Street.
abstract: Cath Internatl Peace Assn meeting speakers hold peace must be based on moral law and internatl police forces
